data.body: Taj‚Äôs biryani is not too spicy and the rice is beautiful ‚Äì light, fluffy, delightfully grainy with pieces of cashews and raisins for a Persian touch. The chicken biryani comes with a whole tender thigh flavourful with masala spices.

reviews.text: This is my favourite briyani food place. Unique taste, soft and tender meat. The taste is fantastic.
Garlic naan and chicken briyani were amazing, and the tandoori was incredible. Definitely a star buy, and super value for money. A must-try in Chinatown!
Dal is super tasty. Sometimes they cook cabbage they are good too. But most of all the chicken korma and the mutton curry are best.

Proper northern Indian home cooked meals.. What they cook, they do it well. Quality ingredients and skilful chef.

My only grouse is, I never seem to hit a time when their food comes out fresh from the kitchen. All the time, food already on display at the counter which is sort of lukewarm already. I just want once to experience fresh from kitchen piping hot as that would be the true measure of how good their food is..

Maybe I just have to come earlier, like before 12.. anyway, you will leave this shop with a satisfied tummy. I recommend it

Absolutely nonsensical. Ordered food. Promised 1 hour delivery. Its been 2 hours. Non receipt of food, but deducted card.
Called multiple times, but no answer.
Please don't order here. False marketing, overpromising and fraud.

data.description: Description
data.name: Taj Authentic Indian Cuisine

data.body: Serving up authentic North Indian & Lebanese food of excellent and consistent quality.

reviews.text: Good palak paneer. Didn't try Lebanese although they have it on the menu.

Had the naan, butter chicken and palak paneer. Really good food.

Update: The Lebanese food is good too.
Falafel roll with fries inside and sweet tomato sauce - didn't like the food
fish briyani was good and there were a lot of fish so it was worth the price. the chicken were fresh and tender too.
Awesome Tandoori Matka Chai. A must try Indian food place in Arab Street. Behind Sultan Mosque, next to Arab Street Singapore

data.description: Serving up authentic North Indian & Lebanese food of excellent and consistent quality.

data.body: Masterchef SG season 1 finalist and foodie, Syamsydar Ani comments that "if you‚Äôre looking for Indian-style Karipap in the area, Sha Zah‚Äôs is (her) top pick. The potato and meat in the Karipap are infused with an aromatic blend of spices, and are enclosed in a pleasantly light and flaky pastry."

reviews.text: Good place to buy variety of carry puff. Delicious..
There's a small queue build up. The puff is nice. It seem that they have increase the price.

Rendang best, come here for rendang only. ... Very fast finish,go early before other Malay come.

Carpark here problem. Must go with buddy. Once wait, another go buy.

Puntuality problem here. Open, rendang not readlly. Don't know what time ready also. Then when you come back, many start queue then unlucky rendang finish. Go back cry
Fantastic Pastries; like Chicken/Mutton Samosaüëçüí™üëç
Definitely better than Indian muslim karipap. Crispy and nice chilli sauce.

data.description: Halal Indian-style Karipap in Geylang area
data.name: Sha Zah Confecitonary

data.body:
Komala Vilas Restaurant has been one of the oldest Indian Vegetarian Restaurants, which started in 1947. It still remains a family run business into its 3rd Generation of owners. We keep it traditional, we keep it fresh, we keep it authentic-  Only for you to enjoy the finest tasting Indian food. 

Komala Vilas is best known for its Dosais and the South Indian Vegetarian Meals. Our chefs are continuously creating new dishes like the Mock Mutton Murtabak, the Fishless Fish curry and the Prawn-less Prawn Sambal. True accompaniments to your Dosai or Rice, or whatever you like! 

Come by to poke the Puffed Bhattura and bite into the chewy dough dunked in Chickpea curry. Perfect for all-day dining at a casual shop house restaurant that conjures nostalgic experiences for many.

reviews.text: Authantic sout india food. Order the simpleast south india meals. Cheap and the most authantic set meal

This place never disappointed me for the past 25 years I have been visiting here. Consistent food quality, great service and reasonable pricing. The staff are always with great attitude and serving. The portions are very generous and servings are 'unlimited'. Keep it up Komala Vilas !! I would love to eat here always.

Good Indian Vegetarian Restaurant. Meals is unlimited at nominal price and the taste is so good.

For Kids  Meals, they charge you at half price. Budget friendly with great quality and  taste.

Must try.
Food taste is not good as before. Actually we paying double the amount of what we actually ate and compares with other shops. They need to change the menu and maintain good taste too.
Nice paneer, value for money talhi sets

data.description: Legacy of Authentic Indian Vegetarian Food
data.name: KOMALA VILAS RESTAURANT

data.body: Indian-Muslim restaurant known for their nasi biryani and murtabak.

reviews.text: Good clean kitchen and toilet. Food taste nice and price is reasonable. Friendly staff.

This restaurant is in a great location as well as infront of a mosque. To enjoy your food much better they have an air-conditioning room above to sit down and relax. Lots of options on their menu card and their staffs are super polite. Absolutely loved the food (it's spicy for people who ain't used to spices food).
The best murtabak in town. Very generous fillings interlaced with eggs. Spicy and delicious curry too.

First time at the restaurant after passing by it a few times. Totally regretted my decision this morming. I was served by a rude staff (tall, male, with a scrawny beard) who told me off for my queries. I had asked about the price of the lamb shank (its $25 or thereabouts) and if they sell mutton korma.
He gave me a condescending look and said korma is same as curry. And when I asked if they had murtabak ready to go (coz I saw them making a bunch at the back) he let go a tirade of verbal abuse and accused me of being able to buy from Islamic Restaurant which is more expensive but had so many questions at his shop (I asked 3 questions to help me make a decision on what to buy). I was shocked and was speechless for a second. I then regained my composure and replied that it's my first time and there was no price list so I had to make enquiries. I was buying the briyani fr Islamic for some one and I didn't have to explain to him anything. I admonished him for being so rude towards me and for his insulting remarks and said that he has lost a customer. He said ok. I then turned to his colleague and informed him that this guy is so rude to me and its intolerable and he just looked helpless, speechless and shook his head.

Looks to me that it's a normal occurrence there looking at the negative reviews on customer service or lack of. I would give it a -ve review if the feature is available. Disgusting. Uncalled for rudeness. Ruined my day.  I am fuming. Avoid at all cost unless you thrive of rude service and insults.

Despite that, as the teh tarik was already made and I do not want to waste food, I paid  for it ($1.20) and walked away after telling this chap to just chill. He may be having a bad day but he has NO RIGHT to dump it on anyone else.

I won't be giving this shop anymore of my hard earned money. Adios.

Disappointing experience.
Only allowed to order egg prata to maximise earning. Waited for 30mins before some of the food came but they left out the curry for some.  Half of the party didn‚Äôt even get to eat at all.
Should have told us earlier if they are attending to huge take away order. But they decided to take our orders and left us hanging.

data.description: Indian-Muslim restaurant known for their nasi biryani and murtabak.
data.name: Al Tasneem

data.body: Known for being one of the top North Indian restaurants in Singapore, Copper Chimney is the place to be for that authentic taste of North Indian cuisine. Whether it's Tandoori Kebab, Naan or Mutton Roganjosh, it will definitely be a treat for the senses. For an interesting twist, try their popular Hakka noodles and Szechuan Fried Rice, made with only the finest Szechuan peppers from China.

reviews.text: Butter Chicken was the best I ever had. Daal was good too. Had 2 orders of naan as the steamed rice cost $4 (too expensive). Simple decor but clean n neat, with soft Indian music.
Ambiance was nice as well as food too..serving was in time plus staffs were very pleasant n informative..care to go again..my kids üòã love it

Authentic Indian food. Best thing I like over here is that the cooking oil is so light that you don‚Äôt feel heavy at the end of the meal like one does in rest of the indian restaurants in town. I really hope they continue to maintain it. Can‚Äôt wait to come back again.

One of the best Indian restaurants in Little India in decent budget. Specially their Indian Chinese cuisine is very well done. Good service in these difficult times. Overall our go to option in Little India now.
Really good quality food, must have chola bhatura. Really tasty

data.description: Known for being one of the top North Indian restaurants in Singapore, Copper Chimney is the place to be for that authentic taste of North Indian cuisine.
data.name: Copper Chimney

data.body: Established in 1924, Ananda Bhavan Restaurant is the oldest Indian vegetarian restaurant in Singapore. Its popular set meals include vegetarian briyani (an Indian spiced rice dish), but the real draw lies in fuss-free items like the boli (sweet lentil flatbread) and pani puri (crispy shells stuffed with tamarind chutney). It prides itself on the fact that no monosodium glutamate (MSG) preservatives or additives are used, keeping the wellness of guests in mind. Main courses from S$9. Ananda Bhavan Restaurant is located in Tekka Centre and other locations islandwide.

reviews.text: Very good
Good location. Food is reasonably priced and tasty. Sometimes it is rather hard to get a seat.

Tasty and healthy vegetarian food at the heart of Little India. Sad that you can't get everything displayed in the menu . They also have special dishes on different days. My favourite would be Thursday!
The selection of Indian Sweets is alot. Come here if you have a sweet tooth üòò
Food  standards drop,  I used yo enjoyed it in the past after COVID19 came about.  I guess change of chief could be possible.

data.description: The oldest Indian vegetarian restaurant in Singapore serves up fuss-free dishes and popular set meals.
data.name: Ananda Bhavan Restaurant

data.body: Indian Muslim restaurant famous for its Soup Tulang (bone marrow soup).

reviews.text: a lot of tables outside the shop. windy atmosphere

Woohooooo!!
Behind the rather mundane facade lies a kitchen with crazily great cooks! The briyani is outrageously awesome!

First time i give 1 star.

Don't expect any service from them and is not the first time already.

My total bill is 14.50 .
I gave $20.
Gave me 4.50 change.
I didn't hear wrongly...
So I went to counter to ask for receipt.
Bill is 14.50 on receipt.

I thought usually... If customer ask for item bill , means something is wrong...
But they choose to ignore.
I went up to ask 1 waiter.
Say my change was 4.50.
$1 less.
He didn't even Bother to listen...
He just went to keep my used plates..
I stood there for a while...
He just ignore...
So it is OK.... I just leave.
I don't think.. I spoke too soft...
But he just don't even want to look at me...
I stood there...
Then I just thought.. forget it.
If they can do like this..
They can do to other customers..

Mutton soup was $8.
With bones..
And 8 piece of square meat.

Tea Aliah is $2.
I think OK...

Prata is newly made..
But not crispy, because all are fast and quick...

Taste is so so ok.

But doubt I will go again.
Spicy kambing soup. The rest of the food normal.

Total ripped off. Avoid this place. I ordered 1 plain prata and 1 egg prata that costs me $7. They didnt prompt me that it doesnt come with the curry so they just ask me to choose mutton or chicken curry, only to find out that I have to pay $4 for the curry. Really such dishonest business. Prices are not made clear.

Made me do an ahegao.
Service can be improved. Too much black pepper in each dishes. Nice renovations on top level, though.
Services good. Nice Teh Alia
Their maggi goreng not bad.

data.body: Serves delicious North Indian dishes such as chicken tikka, dal makhani, naan and more.

reviews.text: Love the food and vibes. Was amazed with the naan size and mixed smoky kebab platters. Will bring my friends to try rest of the food next month
Really good food at good prices. Surprisingly good aloo gobi, too. Plates are a bit smaller than usual so don‚Äôt be afraid to order a bit more than you would.
Service is good BUT the food here is quite not upto mark. I am not sure whats the hype about this place(may the location), it simply did not appeal to me and I dont think I will bounce back.

My family and I enjoyed the food and excellent customer service at Punjaby Dawat. We recommend the mutton rogan josh, Family naan and mutton biryani was out of this world! Truly taste of India! üëçüòã The staff are all really friendly and makes you feel like family! Thank you!
Food is terrible. It looks like they serve  ready made MTR paneer curries and frozen Parathas.

businessHour.description: Mon : Closed, Tue - Thurs, Sun : 12‚Äì2:30pm 5:30‚Äì11pm, Fri - Sat : 12‚Äì2:30pm 5:30‚Äì11:55pm

reviews.text: Great food and good for casual business meetings. Sometimes the waiters taking the order don't understand the item being told to them. Maybe they are new or not aware of the items. Not a roadblock.
Food quality and taste is good. Service is very slow. Hospitality attitude from the manager needs high improvement. He would make you feel uninvited to the restaurant.

Food is good but the service was essentially non existent. They seemed to be focusing more on trying to lure people in rather than taking care of people already seated inside. Forgot virtually every order we made and needed constant reminding. On top of that had the cheek to include a service charge which I paid because I was trying to be generous in these tough times else I would have simply refused. Left a very poor impression

Lovely place for really unique desi cocktails! They have a huge menu of gin cocktails. Food is really good and spicy. Cheese naan is yummy! Lovely view of the mosque in the outside seating :) highly recommend

Bad service, great food

We were so looking forward to food and enjoying our Friday evening with the Flying monkey, hence made advance reservations.

We ordered lot of food and cocktails were great. However what was annoying was they literally wanted us to clear table in 30min! We paid bill and were out in flat 45mins, most places have 90mins per table.

Extremely disappointed that they were rushing each table yesterday. And we had to go to other place.

data.description: Enjoy authentic Pan-Indian cuisine and craft cocktails in a fun and quirky space.

data.body: MeatSmith Little India is Singapore‚Äôs first restaurant serving Modern Indian Barbecue. With its colorful fa√ßade and street artwork, this outlet fits perfectly at its home, at Campbell Lane in the heart of Little India.

reviews.text: Meaty little smith in little India which offers sumptuous food! Must try are the meat balls and fish main course. They are also known for their signature butter chicken (we couldn‚Äôt get our hands on as the prep takes about 45 mins). Will surely try next time! The service was excellent and the servers took good care of the patrons. They also know the food well and can suggest some excellent stuff to go with one‚Äôs pallet. Will definitely recommend this place to hangout with friends or family or date nights. Kudos to the entire team!
Great food. The MS cheeseburger just melts in your mouth. Be prepared to queue because there will be a big crowd drinking and gathering on weekends.

Came here on Christmas Eve to have the Christmas set menu and thought the food was alright. Downside was the portion sizes which were small and therefore didn‚Äôt make the meal seem like great value, went home not feeling full. Cocktails were good.
Excellent food and ambience with a nice east meets west vibe. Definitely a must try in Little India. Service and decoration are as good as the food.

came as part of singapore restaurant week. food is excellent, really well done lamb and cauliflower. blast of spice with every bite. top notch service from K. running the floor alone but top attention paid to every individual.

data.description: MeatSmith Little India is Singapore‚Äôs first restaurant serving Modern Indian Barbecue.
data.name: Meat Smith Little India

data.body:
Uncover this hidden gem in the heart of Little India where it is not just about food. Learn about Indian cuisine and culture with Master Chef Kaesavan (K7), and bask in the warm hospitality of Curry Mummy Kumaarrie and Teacher Shanti.

At this chef-owned restaurant, you are invited to kick off your shoes and make yourself at home. Like home-cooked food, no MSG is used in our cooking. The flavors are brought out with the thoughtful play of spices and cooking techniques. The dishes are made with fresh quality ingredients and ayurvedic philosophy.

Discover your #ChilliLevels and enjoy our food at your preferred spice level. For the adventurous chilli lovers, discover your threshold with our #ChilliChallenge.

Lagnaa is available for dine-in, delivery and takeaway. Place your reservations and orders on http://order.lagnaa.com/ to get flavourful Indian food at your fingertips!
data.notes: Please make your reservation on http://order.lagnaa.com

reviews.text: The concept is very original and fun (dining while seated on the floor, spice challenge) and the service is some of the best I've experienced in Singapore. Food is excellent as well. Only reason I rate 4 and not 5 stars is I don't think the high price is quite justified, although I'll likely come back.

The Food was awesome! Service was really good very friendly and a home like feel ambiance. My family enjoyed so much we even tried some of their spicy curries! Will be back a definitely! üòä Keep the good Miss Shanti and company! God‚Äôs blessings!

This place is awesome. The staff is so warm and friendly, they really made us feel at home. We opted to dine upstairs, where you are barefoot and sit on the floor and loved the experience. The food was great though next time we‚Äôll go for the √† la carte menu so we can select some spicier dishes. Can‚Äôt wait to visit again soon!

Staffs are friendly and always explain the food in details to customise to the patrons taste. One of the best restaurants I have encounter. Food quality as perfect as ever. Definitely will recommend my friends there! Well done to everyone working in the restaurant ! Please keep up the good work and great taste of food ! =)

Lovely staff, talented chef, delicious food. Nearly died after my last visit, though... but nobody to blame but myself! üå∂üå∂üå∂üå∂üå∂üå∂üå∂ I conquered Level 7 (including half an hour sitting there after polishing off the last drops) to attain my superior clothes peg status at the Full Moon Chilli Challenge and happily and smugly walked home. But the rest of that night was completely miserable üî•üí©üî•‚ö°Ô∏èü§Æ‚ö°Ô∏èü§Æ‚ö°Ô∏èü§Æ‚ö°Ô∏èüî•üí©üî•

data.description: Discover the 6 flavours of authentic Indian cuisine at this homely MICHELIN Guide Restaurant.
data.name: Lagnaa... barefoot dining

data.body: Housing a wide variety of Malay and Indian food, Geylang Serai Market and Food Centre makes a great stop for hungry travellers. For tasty bites, visit Kueh Talam Asli (#02-148) for an assortment of kueh talam, a two-layered Malaysian dessert, and Otak-Otak Kampung (#02-164) for otah (spicy fish paste grilled in banana leaf). For a hearty meal, tuck into Malay-style chicken rice at Nasi Ayam Sambal (#02-129). Its unique spicy sambal adds a kick to the dish and is highly recommended. To cool down, enjoy smooth and deliciously rich chendol (a dessert with jelly, coconut milk and palm sugar syrup) from Cendol Geylang Serai (#02-107).

reviews.text: Everything a Malay family need to buy under one roof.
So many stalls to choose, gandos , it's the only place in S'pore üëçüëçüëç
Good market but still quite dirty.
It very clean but it clean every 3 month only. Must follow like kallang every month clean the market
hot n crowded..feels like it's the weekend.

data.description: From snacks to filling meals, the food centre offers plenty of Malay and Indian food.
data.name: Geylang Serai Market and Food Centre

data.body:
Gayatri Restaurant started the restaurant Operations in 1996 at Chander Road and two years later relocated at 19 Race Course Lane Off Serangoon Road. The new restaurant branch is currently open at 122 Race Course Road with the aim of providing our customers tasty and delicious food.

Gayatri is known for electic northern and southern Indian cuisine, our restaurant is also noted for its open concept kitchen where inquisitive diners can peek at the chefs flipping naans or grilling thier favourite Tandoori dish behind tempered glass walls. We also provide catering services for private functions including family celebration, weddings, corpo- rate and community events. We are capable or handling up to 5,000 patrons a day, usually on busy weekends or public holidays. We had catered to functions and parties for Bollywood & Kollywood stars from India as well as commu- nity events graced by Singapore ministers, MPs and grassroots leaders.

reviews.text:
Great food and great service.

Still awesome, after all this time, and I had to say it when asked to update my review. I still feel it is great value and great taste!

This Indian restaurant has been here for ages. There was already a queue when I arrived at 6.25pm on a Wednesday. Food is good without question. The staff though busy is accommodating and helpful. Limited roadside parking right outside the restaurant. There is a HDB multi-storey car park about 5 minutes walk behind the restaurant.

Decent south Indian restaurant. Not expensive.. south India  food was really good, surprise to see veg items were good in a non-veg dominated restaurant... not so good for north Indian dishes in my opinion.

Very good selection of Indian dishes with great taste. Friendly waiter and very helpful at explaining the different for choices from the display. Naans were large and generous portions. We will be back. üòÄ

Consistency in the way every dish is done. I have been to Gayatri rest @ race course rd umpteen times and it has always left a tasteful memory ....
However I hv noticed some waiters/tress have an attitude & they can be rude at times.
I hope every feedback shall be helpful. Cheers

data.description: At Gayatri, we take that one step further by serving you authentic Indian flavours that will remind you of your mother's cooking and India. Served in a cosy family-friendly setting, our chefs from India bring you traditional Indian food, both North Indian and South Indian, guaranteeing to whet everyone's appe- tite. Being one of the oldest banana leaf establishments in Little India, we endeavour to bring you the best Indian food in Singapore at affordable prices.
data.name: Gayatri Restaurant

data.body: Visitors seeking authentic hawker fare in a more refined setting should head to StraitsKitchen at Grand Hyatt Singapore, Singapore‚Äôs first SG Clean Quality Mark hotel. Smart casual dress code applies. This restaurant serves a sumptuous buffet spread of local favourites (lunch: S$62++; dinner: S$72++), including dishes of the Peranakans (Straits-born people of Chinese and Malay/Indonesian heritage), Chinese and Indian cuisine, and popular hawker staples such as satay (grilled meat skewers), laksa (spicy coconut milk-based noodle soup) and chicken rice, all in a chic steel-and-marble dining hall. For dessert, the freshly made nonya kueh (bite-sized snacks or desserts) and homemade ice creams are not to be missed at StraitsKitchen. Child rates available.

reviews.text: Average local food served in a hotel. Can get better cooking at the local restaurants / cafe. Was disappointed when I saw that the cakes they served for dessert is from a local bakery (taken straight out from the bakery box to the buffet table!) and not baked by the hotel's baker. Was crowded but the staff did a good job trying their best to clear the dishes etc

Straits Kitchen is a buffet setting with many varieties of Asian dishes to choose from. Love the ambience and the food taste great. The staffs were helpful, courteous, friendly and attentive. Halal certified and Highly recommended!

Oh Straits Kitchen What Is There NOT TO Love About This Place‚Ä¶

Can‚Äôt Recall A Time Went The Food & Service Has Not Met My Expectation.

Be It Breakfast, Lunch Or Dinner.. The Food Is Always Fantastic & VERY FRESH

Some managers there need to educate themselves. Showing their unprofessionalism and not knowing how to talk to customers is ruining the whole dining experience despite paying the hefty amount.
Ordering any drink from the table just take ages to come or will never come. Indian food and Malay food is good but Chinese food is below average.The dessert choices were also very limited.
This is long-overdue! I had my birthday celebration here and we really enjoyed ourselves! The food was fantastic! Thank you!

data.description: Enjoy a sumptuous buffet spread of local delights ranging from Peranakan to Chinese to Indian dishes at this chic restaurant.
data.name: StraitsKitchen

data.body: A 110-year-old Southern Indian-Muslim restaurant that is famous for its murtabak, a flatbread with meat fillings.

reviews.text: Long time not come here. Friendly staff. Two storey shop hse. Nice food. Serve nit only Indian food. There lot halal food sold there. Awesome
You either like victory or you don't like victory. And holding a peace sign while coming in for vehicle pick up means you want victory and not the other shop.
ok

ordered today at 5.30 and waited 30 mins for the order. not even the drinks were served. we had to call the waiter and ask where our order is. had to ask them multiple times regarding our order. after waiting again they sent us the wrong order. such a disappointment and will never go here again.

Briyani, Murtabak and everything delicious. Service is fast, prompt and fresh. The place boast a 2 storey seating capacity with air conditioning. Be sure to try their briyani and murtabak. Love it and definitely will return again for more

data.body:
Vegetarian-friendly, Vegan-friendly, Jain-friendly

Caf√© Salivation is the first Western vegetarian caf√© in Little India and offers vegan-friendly fare with subtle Indian influences. Aromatic spices are used to create flavourful, well-balanced dishes such as the grilled Desi Sandwich with green chutney and a mix of grilled potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers. The caf√© can omit onion and garlic upon request. For sweets, there are the vegan options such as the Coconut Rose Pannacotta (S$6.50++). A weekday teatime set with a choice of cake and coffee is available throughout the day.

reviews.text: We went for my birthday dinner and tried these items, they were good. They actually are a combined restaurant+cafe (cafe salivation + Raj restaurant), they have 2 different menu for cafe and restaurant (Indian), we tried from Cafe menu this time and all were good. I will recommend it.

Horrendous staff.
I visited here for lunch expecting to get some good food and service. But I was wrong. There is a man who is incredibly rude to you. He needs to learn how to respect customers. We used a voucher and informed them about it. That is when they started to act hostile and rude towards us. We could clearly see the frown. We ordered the Mexican lasagna and Hawaiian pizza. The lasagna tasted a little stale and rubbery. I felt this occurred because it was a little under cooked. We had to wait for a really long time to get our pizza. We sat there waiting for 45 minutes straight. One of the waiters almost cleared our plates. It was embarrassing. The pizza was very cheesy and did not have any unique flavour. We ordered a Hawaiian pizza, and they only sprinkled a little of bell peppers and pineapple on the top.
The hygiene is also awful. Cafe salvation and Raj is one restaurant.
Overall, horrible service and inefficient staff. Definitely not visiting this place again.
We ate kachori, pizza, hummas and pita bread but i loved that pepper tomato pasta which was awesome good place to eat specially for vegetarian

I called to ask one of the staff some details about a dish, and he was rude. I asked him how big is one portion and he said ‚Äúhow will I know that?‚Äù and laughed.
And then I asked him if it was vegetarian and he answered irritatingly saying yes of course everything is vegetarian.
And he answered in a way that seemed like I was already supposed to know it.
He needs to learn basic manners and how to respond to customers.
Nice space but service could be better. It was one of those days where we had to wait v long for our food & then they forgot an order üò∞

data.pricing: Acai bowls from S$8++; Mains from S8.50++; Sweets, Breakfast and Starter menus available
data.description: The first Western vegetarian restaurant in Little India, Caf√© Salivation offers vegan-friendly fare with Indian influences.
data.name: Caf√© Salivation

data.body: This family-owned business opened more than 50 years ago in a corner of Dempsey Road and continues to draw diners to that very same location today. The Indian restaurant, simply decorated and mostly ventilated by ceiling fans, seats up to 300 guests and serves dishes on fresh banana leaves. Diners can choose from dishes like briyani (an Indian spiced rice dish with meat or vegetables), fried cauliflower, Mysore mutton and masala (a marinade of mixed Indian spices) chicken; or order their bestsellers such as the fish cutlet and curry fish head‚Äìfresh red snapper fish head stewed in a curry with assorted vegetables.

reviews.text: We had fried fish, crab curry with tandoori prawns. Everything was delicious. It tastes like home. The crispy papadums were a great accompaniment and we couldn't have enough. Love the understated simple ambience, feels like you're back 2-3 decades ago.  Friendly staff. Tastes better when you eat with your hands.  Reasonable price, not TOO spicy.

Seems to be more crowded every time but the quick service and table turnaround makes for a short wait. Service is prompt but it can be best described as unfriendly. But for the efficiency achieved it‚Äôs okay. The food? Authentic, spicy, flavourful and particularly friendly on the wallet.

Very authentic & spicy Indian food I have eaten in a long long time. At a lot of places, spicy will just be an overdose of chilli, but here it's a perfect blend of spices which enhances the flavor and satisfies your taste buds.

The banana leaf adds to the authenticity!

Best Indian food around. Generous portions (like scoops of rice and curry until you tell them to stop) served on a banana leaf. Staff was friendly and helpful in giving recommendations. The fish tikka and butter chicken was so good, will come back again.

Good service and reasonable price.
Also taste is good. Interested.
I became to like here!!
Indian world is there.
No air controllers.

data.pricing: Fish Head Curry from S$21 to S$33; √° la carte menu from S$2.10 a serving
data.description: This dining establishment has been serving up plates iconic Indian dishes like fish  head curry, for over 50 years.
data.name: Samy's Curry
